item.description:
In the game "Das Versteck des Goldgräbers" (Goldminer's cache), players embark on an exciting journey back in time to the small gold mining village Goldtal in 1849. In the role of sheriff Edward Lawson, they investigate two mysterious murders. Are they related to an extraordinary gold find? 
The game includes a virtual part (smartphone/tablet) as well as real items - the remnants of a serious crime that has survived to this day. Players are challenged to solve different kinds of puzzles to progress through the story.

Game can be played as:

 cooperative mode
 competitive mode
 run against time

Far away and long ago, an asteroid slammed into the planet TAH.

It brought death, and changed the world for the descendants of those who survived. 
Remnants of the ancient impact are found as seams of purple crystal imbedded within the strata of native stones. This crystal, called Neonite, possesses mystic properties. Properly harnessed Neonite can levitate objects of unlimited mass and size. Kings, and warlords, revolutionaries and despots seek out neonite, each seeking absolute control of their people and their rivals. 
Massing their armies in huge flying castles, they push the borders of their realms, expanding into the territory of their enemies at the vanguard of ruthless armies.

Take control of one of 6 Races and use your flying castle to send out farmers, miners, and armies to prove that you are the rightful ruler of TAH. Gather resources, complete quests, and buy stronger armies. Rotate and move your castle (Dice Tower) on one of 4 different maps.

Align your dice tower chute with an opponent’s dice tower and deploy your armies (dice) to attack their defenses.
Earn 5 Crowns before any other player to win the game, and rule TAH, until the next War.
Can you defeat your enemies and secure your title as ruler of TAH?

—description from the publisher

name.value: Where To? A Travel Adventure Game

item.description:
Travel alongside Little Passports characters, Sam and Sofia, as they scoot around the world. Roll the die and head toward different destinations. On your way, you can Scooter Boost across the globe, or test your Traveler’s Luck to see where you end up. You may even get invited to a Celebration! Each time you reach your card’s destination, add that card to your Travel Journal to make it a memory. The first player to collect five memories wins.

—description from the publisher

Murder Mystery party game that you host at home for 8-12 players who dress up as their characters. One of them is the murderer and the others must figure out who it is by studying the clues, police report, map, crime scene photos, and cross examining the other players.

It’s early century, but the rapid development of steam technology makes it feel like we are living in the far future. Steam power has ushered in a technological age with machines and devices that are amazing. Steam power is modern power, yet the age old drives of greed, lust, envy, and hate still guide us, and still, murder happens.

The guests in this steampunk world arrive at the Lilly Hotel to gather in this quaint place in the middle of town, yet surrounded by woods. Actually, that sounds a little creepy. It’s a comfortable establishment with good food, but the Lilly’s claim to fame are the seances held there. So ghosts are expected, as are the lost loved ones. Perhaps what is surprising are all the tawdry foibles of the living; greed, secrets, lust, and the soon to be dearly departed.

So sit down at the table and as soon as the honored guest arrives by steam driven airship you can be assured of an interesting evening… and that someone ain’t gonna make it.

—description from the publisher

It's not enough to think for your opponent
In this game you BECOME your opponent!

Objective: Be the first to form a straight line of 4 pawn in a row (horizontal, vertical or diagonal) in your chosen color.

 First, players choose either Red or White for their pawn color.
 Each player gets 7 playing pieces , each consisting of a red pawn and a white pawn connected by an elastic band.
 Taking turns, players add 1 playing piece to the board, and stretch the band accordingly. Note: Players place both their own color and that of their opponent in the same turn.
 The first player to form a straight line of 4 pawns in his or her color wins the game!
 All 14 playing pieces placed with no winner? Player then take turns moving their own pawns until someone wins!

WELCOME TO THE FUTURE OF CITY BUILDING!

GOLD COAST, AUSTRALIA, 2100. Construction of the first oceanic MegaCity begins. Tackling overpopulation and rising sea levels has become the planet’s number one priority.

Advances in technology enable us to build towering superstructures on immense floating platforms. You are the next generation of architects called upon to design and build these marvels of structural engineering.

Race to collect contracts, construct beautiful buildings and vie for awards as a unique MegaCity emerges each time you play. It’s a competitive business where prestige points are everything!

A combination of dexterity and light strategy, MegaCity: Oceania is the city building game in which you actually build a unique city every time.


Players create a brand new MegaCity by collecting Building Tiles, Building Pieces and Contracts. However, this is not a co-operative game - you are battling to score Prestige points based upon the contracts you complete. Players can also gain bonus Prestige points by creating tallest buildings, using a single material, and placing monuments in Parks. At the end of the game, Awards are handed out that contribute to the final score, and points are lost if players have any pieces left over in their personal supplies. Whoever has the highest total is declared the winner, and the finest architect in your new MegaCity.

Players build when it's not their turn, meaning this is a game with little downtime. A combination of dexterity, light strategy and creativity make MegaCity a truly unique experience - a city building game where you actually build a brand new city every time you play!

A game about Wielkopolska uprising in 1918/1919 years. Polish soldiers fights with Germans occupiers in West Poland after I World War. A game with card movement and combat. The German player start with 9 cards a Polish player with 5. The players fight for cities or important places. The score for 1 hex is 1, 2 or 3 points.The hex with 3 points gives a German Side the cards for all turns. Polish player must take cards from hex (there are unknown) or from German player. The Polish side took before game a card with target places: politician ,military or industrial. This object give him extra points on end game. Player with with higher score win the game after 6 turn. One card gives a movement and attack for one stack on board or one reinforces. The Polish side discard played card, A German side becomes in all turn 9 cards (if he has 3 points object).

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: 100% Beef Showdown is a card-drafting game in which players try to assemble "poker" hands from different parts of beef and bone. In each of three rounds, players draft a hand of six cards, then create a "cow" of five cards, flipping the sixth card face down to serve as the head of the cow. If you win the round, then you score the points shown on the head of the cow, while other players get to keep their head cards as "stock" for use in the subsequent round.

link.value: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

item.description:
"La Sfida agli 8000" is an educational game about safety, equipment, etiquette and more about the world of mountain hiking. The game is co-designed by Marco Confortola, a professional Italian climber who already conquered ten "eight-thousanders".

Players compete in two or more teams. Teams win by climbing and conquering all of the fourteen eight-thousanders and to do so, they need the correct equipment. Equipment is won by correctly answering questions about the word of hiking, trivia style.

—description from the publisher

A game by Nicolas Stratigos, VaeVictis jeux d'histoire series
The battle of Kiev 1943, is the third game of the Storms in the East series

After the failure of Zitadelle in mid-July 1943, then the loss of Kharkov on 23 August, the German armies surged back on the Dnieper with the Soviet forces at their heels. The Voronezh Front of Vatutin had the mission of charging on Kiev and destroying the 4. Panzerarmee.
On 21 September, the 3rd Guards Tank Army reached the Dnieper and established a bridgehead at Bukrin, near Kanev, soon joined by the 27th and 70th Armies. On 26 September, the Soviets dropped two paratrooper brigades on Kanev. The operation was a disaster. Meanwhile, the 38th Army forced the river at Lyutezh, 20 km north of Kiev.
The Soviets launched another operation from Bukrin mid-October with no result. The Stavka realised the tactical impasse of this bridgehead and decided – in absolute secrecy – to transfer Rybalko’s 3rd Guards Tank Army into the pocket of Lyutezh.
Vatutin prepared a large-scale attack on Kiev. On 3 November, more than 2000 canons discharged a flood of fire on the units of the VII. and XIII. Korps; the 68th and 88th infantry divisions were impotent against the 38th Army supported by Kravchenko’s 5th Guards Tank Corps. Farther north, the 60th Army attacked in the direction of Korosten.
Despite the counter-attacks of the 7. and 8. Panzer and of the 20th Pz.Grenadier, Rybalko’s men entered Kiev and completely liberated it on 6 November. Fastov fell on 7 November, and the Soviet troops advanced on the entire Front. Jitomir fell at the hands of the 1st Guards Cavalry Corps on 12 November. The Soviets advanced more than 120 km to the west!
The Germans sent reinforcements from everywhere. The 25. Panzer somehow slowed down the Soviets at Fastov with numerous losses; the 1. SS, the 2. SS and the 1. Pz Divisions blocked the Soviet advance in the south.
On 13 November, Von Manstein launched a counter offensive with the 48. PzKorps toward Jitomir and Brusilov in the southern flank of the Soviet penetration.
As a Soviet, will you be able to liberate Kiev for the anniversary of the Bolshevik Revolution ? As a German, will you restore the front of the 4. Panzerarmee ?

—description from the publisher

Un jeu de Nicolas Stratigos dans la collection VaeVictis jeu d'histoire.
Kiev 1943, est le 3e volume de la série Orage à l'Est.

Après l’échec de Zitadelle mi-juillet 1943 puis la perte de Kharkov le 23 août, les armées allemandes refluent sur le Dniepr, talonnées par les forces soviétiques. Le front de Voronezh de Vatutin a pour mission de foncer sur Kiev et détruire la 4. Panzerarmee.
Le 21 septembre, la 3e armée de chars de la Garde atteint le Dniepr et établit une tête de pont à Boukrine, près de Kanev, bientôt rejoint par les 27e et 70e armées. Le 26 septembre, les Soviétiques larguent deux brigades de parachutistes sur Kanev mais l’opération tourne au désastre. Pendant ce temps, la 38e armée force le fleuve à Lyutezh, 20 km au nord de Kiev. Le 30 septembre, Le groupe d’armées Sud a enfin franchi le Dniepr. Mi-octobre, les Soviétiques lancent de nouveau une opération à partir de Boukrine mais sans résultat. Se rendant compte de l’impasse tactique de cette tête de pont, la Stavka décide le transfert – dans le plus grand secret – de la 3e armée blindée de la Garde de Rybalko dans la poche de Lyutezh.
Vatutin prépare alors une attaque d’envergure sur Kiev. Le 3 novembre, plus de 2 000 canons déversent un déluge de feu sur les unités des VII. et XIII. Korps, Les 68. et 88. ID ne peuvent rien face à la 38e armée soutenue par le 5e corps de chars de la Garde. Plus au nord la 60e armée attaque en direction de Korosten.
Malgé les contre-attaques des 7.et 8. Panzer et de la 20. Pz.Grenadier, les hommes de Rybalko entrent dans Kiev et la libère totalement le 6 novembre. Fastov tombe le 7 novembre, les troupes soviétiques avancent sur tout le front. Jitomir tombe aux mains du 1er corps de cavalerie de la Garde le 12 novembre. Les Soviétiques ont alors avancé de plus de 120 km à l’ouest ! Les Allemands envoient des renforts de partout. La 25. Panzer ralentit tant bien que mal les Soviétiques à Fastov avec de nombreuses pertes, les 1. SS, 2. SS et la 1. Pz bloquent l’avancée soviétique au sud.
Le 13 novembre, Von Manstein lance une contre-offensive avec le 48. Panzer Korps vers Jitomir et Brusilov dans le flanc sud de la pénétration soviétique…
Saurez vous, en tant que Soviétique, libérer Kiev pour l’anniversaire de la Révolution bolchévique et en tant qu’Allemand restaurer le front de la 4. Panzerarmee ?

—description from the publisher (French)

As a clan leader, you will go on a mission with a small group to eliminate your archrival. You must complete this mission with six specialized warriors. Do you know how best to use your team's skills?

Players try to beat their opponents by using their dice in all sorts of combinations. This allows them to perform various attacks in order to damage the opponent's team. If a player succeeds in eliminating the clan leader or all of the opponent's attacking warriors, then that player has won the game.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Gather your friends and sit down to play LOOP: The Elevated Card Game. Ride the rails of the elevated trains in Chicago's famous Loop! Match the line colors and stations to make your way around town, but beware the everyday perils of rush hour crowds, forgotten farecards, and mysterious puddles as you get where you're going!
—description from the publisher

Gameplay is similar to UNO or Crazy Eights, but instead of matching numbers, suites, or colors, players match the L line or station. For example, if the top of the pile is a Brown Line card for the Washington/Wells station, you can play any other Brown Line, or another Washington/Wells card (as if you’re transferring lines in real life). The object of the game is to get rid of all of your cards first. The player who most recently used public transportation gets to deal.
—user summary

A trick taking game where you become a cake shop and sell cakes to your customers. From beginners to experienced people can play.

Play Summary

Each turn, the Leader plays a card. He takes the "Customer" card with the corresponding cake and places it next to the just played cake card.
Then, the player to the left plays and then in clockwise order plays a card.

 Play a card with the same colour; if he can’t follow color, he places any color card in his correponding "Storage Area"
 "0" card of other other cake can be used as a wild card (i.e. can be used to follow the lead suit)
 If he plays a card with value 0-3, he can pull the cards from his "Storage Area" of that cake type and add all these to get a new total value
 Compare the sum of the just played card with previous played card(s)
 If the sum is same or smaller, he puts all cards into his own "Storage Area" of that cake type
 If the sum is larger, the previous card(s) is/are put into the owner’s "Storage Area" of that cake type. He gets the "Customer" card and place it beside his just played cake card(s).
 He chooses a card from the replenish row to refill his hand
 The Leader gets the final remaining card from the replenish row.




 
The player with card(s) still on the table is the winner. If he is the leader, he takes the cake card as his score and returns the "Customer" card to the supply. If a fellow player wins, he takes the cake card as his score. He also gets the "Customer" card and the "Start Player" card. He now scores 3x points for that cake.
 At the end of the game, each collected cake card scores 1 pt (3 pts 3 pts 3 pts with the corresponding "Customer" card). Who has the highest points wins.

Oh Fruck is a raucous card game that combines strategy with special rules that change every time you play. Fun-filled game for 2-6 players (up to 12 players when combined with another deck). Be the first player to discard all your cards, but watch out for the special rules … and don’t get Frucked. Includes over 100 cards (2.5 x 3.5 inches), box, instructions, plus a Benevolent order of Fruckers membership card. It’s the only card game for real Fruckers.

—description from the publisher

Election! is a game about Australian Federal elections.

Players play as either government or opposition party through a number of days, represented by event cards, of an election campaign. Events give margin points to either party, and the player winning those points can play a strategy card for bonus points, which in turn can be countered by a strategy card played by their opponent. Once all event cards have been evaluated, the player with the most margin points wins the election, and thus the game.

name.value: Fire! Fire! Scouts to the Rescue!

item.description:
The game entitled "Fire! Fire! Scouts to the Rescue" is a replica of a rare vintage 1920s board game of the same name. 
—user summary

Fire trucks and engines have always caught the imagination of children all over the world. Excitement mounts as the siren is heard coming closer and then the fire engine rushes by. This lovely board game is based on another era when the fire trucks and engines moved at a more sedate pace! Things have changed since the 1920s and 30s but this game is still great fun for all the family.
—description from the publisher

This is a Monopoly-style game with a "The Polar Express" theme. This collector's edition game was sold by the Masterpieces Inc. company.
—user summary

Relive the magic of The Polar Express adventure with this gameboard featuring the characters and places of the movie. Enjoy trivia, movie moments, and character quotes on the back of each property card. Each game contains a custom gameboard filled with gorgeous imagery and striking detail, 6 custom collectible pewter tokens, 28 property cards featuring interesting brand-themed trivia, 32 action cards, 1 pack of illustrated money, 44 custom designed plastic property markers, 2 dice, and illustrated rules. All Aboard!
—description from the publisher

In the Joker Cup, players will ride a jumping horses through the course with different obstacles. The dice indicates the speed of the horse but it is important to land on the right box to jump flawlessly.
But players may also use cards for helping the horses.
Who finds the shortest route to end is the winner.

UGO: Magic Garden is based on the highly praised UGO! In UGO: Magic Garden you are a wizard taking part in a yearly contest for becoming the best wizard. You're trying to plant exotic plants in your garden. There are easy, fertile patches of garden, but also patches that need the help of garden gnomes. You can also cheat by hiring goblins. But beware! At the end of the game, you'll be checked to see if you haven't cheated.

—description from the publisher

A card, turn-based strategy game without dice.

In Leida Heim each player take control of a Norse mythology hero. At the end of the game who earned more honor is proclaimed winner.
The game uses an action points system to make heroes move and perform actions.

—description from the publisher

In this turn based futuristic game, all human sports have been outlawed and replaced with the state approved sport of Jolt! where mechs try to force opposing mechs out of the ever shrinking arena, the winner is the player who controls the last mech standing.

Each player has 2 mechs where each one performs actions on alternate turns. Mechs can move, jolt other mechs in an attempt to force them out of the arena.

The arena is formed of a number of hexes and hexes can only be travelled over a number of times before they power down. Any mech that moves into a powered down hex for any reason is eliminated from the game.

Each player has the opportunity to spend some of their AP for the turn to purchase Powerplay cards, which are kept hidden until played and gives a small boost for that turn.

—description from the designer

A new guest has arrived at the "Jardin des Mondes". It's Hao Hao, a wonderful giant panda! Help him find new friends and discover his new environment. But watch out for the snow leopard, he can jump at any moment. Be sharp and move Hao Hao thoughtfully. He will always be thankful.

Progress of the game:

On their turn, each player plays the following steps in order :


 The player reveals 1 tile that is in sight of Hao Hao's figurine;
 According to the animal that has just been flipped, the player has to reveal 1 or 2 more tiles, if they match, they can collect them;
 The player moves Hao Hao;
 All the tiles still face up are turned face down.


The game ends when Hao Hao cannot be moved to a tile face down. Players count their points (roughly equal to the number of tiles they've collected) and the player with most points wins.

A party game for those who feel the need to say something completely inappropriate. Incorrect politically, hilarious and eccentric.

To start the game, each player draws eight white cards. One player becomes a Reader. He randomly draws a black card and reads the question or fill-in-the-blanks phrase out loud. Each player chooses an answer from white cards kept in hand and passes it face down to the Reader. The Reader shuffles received cards and successively reads the answers and arranges them on the table. It's best to read the answers together with the question matching the syntax where it's needed. Some questions require two white cards. In this case, the Reader does not shuffle them and reads in the order arranged by players. When all responses have been read, each player points the finger at the funniest answer. The player whose answer got the most votes wins the round and gets the black card as a reward. When it's a draw, each of the drawers wins and gets a black card. Before next round everyone draws cards up to eight, the next player becomes a Reader. The game lasts until no cards, time or participants left. The player who earned the most black cards wins.

—user summary

In this game, 3-6 players are Greek Gods that secretly support in a friendly or enemy way the geek hero Ulysses, coming back from the war of troy.

To come back to Itacha, Ulysses will face 7 quests like the encounter with Polyphemos, the journey in the hades, the resistance of the mermaides’ song and the meeting with Circe, the witch. In each of these encounters, each God can Change Ulysses’ main abilities (strenght, guile, oratory, luck and charisma) to make the journey easier or… much harder!

Play your abilities cards in the right moment, use special powers and try to understand who is your friend and who is your enemy as soon as possible to win this game beatiful illustrated by the italian artist “Idras”.

Odyssey is the second game of the Greek series, after Mythomakya designed by Luca Feliciani.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Murder mystery party game for 8-12 players that you host at home. Each player dresses up as a character, one is the murderer and the rest must figure out who that is. To solve the mystery there are clues, police report, crime scene photos, and a map. You go over these materials then question all the players about what their characters did and saw to finally solve who done it. The game lasts a times 2.5 hours.

Remember the excitement and glamour of your Senior Prom? Well now you can relive it, 1980s style. McKinley High School is having their Senior Prom, and like your typical prom there will be punch, snacks, a student rock band, and the coronation of the prom king and queen.
This could be any American population, with the in-crowd, jocks, geeks, dopers, losers, and even the well liked, super cool drug dealer. Don’t you remember how fun it all was?
On this particular prom night though there is more going on than your standard spiked punch and necking in a dark corner. Real murder and mayhem is brewing. By the end of the night you will be shocked and astonished and will have lost a considerable amount of respect for your fellow students and the school faculty (who would have thought!).
So throw on a boutonniere, squeeze into that tiny gown, fluff your hair up big and get ready to boogey on down with some punch, canapes, cookies, and some drop dead entertainment.

—description from the publisher

ZU Tiles is a tile placement game based loosely on the creatures of the Chinese Zodiac. Players make custom decks choosing from the 196 tiles in the first "Alpha" set and use those decks to try to be the first to score 12 points.

ZU Tiles is a quick and easy game for the whole family that focuses more on compatibility than it does combat and more on fun and actual enjoyment of the game vs. the sometimes cutthroat competition that other more serious and competitive deck building games might be about. Relax. Take your time. Smile more. Enjoy yourself.

—description from the designer

You’ve been hired by Walking Doggos, a subsidiary of Good Boyes, Inc.

Your job? Walking the goodest doggos every day for minimum wage while their owners are at work.

It doesn’t matter how many dogs you walk, or how hard you work, you get paid the same no matter what.

So, what does a clever slacker like you do? As little as possible without getting fired.

Walking Doggos is a trick-taking game, where the goal is to take fewer tricks than your opponents while still at least winning one trick. There are six suits of cards: Great Danes, Labradors, Shiba Inus, Beagles, Corgis, and Pugs ranked by size of the breed. Each suit has a card numbered 1 through 8 representing the number of that breed that need to be walked.

Players each have a hand of 5 cards held face out, so that only other players can see what cards are being held. Players take turns giving clues to other players as to what cards are in their hand. Once every player has 3 clues, players take turns betting how many tricks they are going to take. After all players have made their bets, players take turns playing a card face up into a pack to be walked. The player who played the highest ranked doggo wins the pack. Players get points based on the number of packs they take compared to what they bet. The winner is the player who did the least amount of work necessary without being fired.

-description from designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
CAB! is an educational card game based on the parts of speech. It involves turn-taking, incidental learning, peer teaching, spelling and grouping. 
The game has the potential to improve vocabulary and literacy skills while engaging students in a fun experience.

OBJECTIVE
Be the first person to get rid of all your cards
  
SETUP
Each person draws a card. The player who’s card has the greatest number of letters is the dealer. 
The dealer shuffles the deck and gives each player 7 cards.

Then places the remainder of the deck face down to create a ‘pick up’ pile. 
The dealer takes the top card off the ‘pick up’ pile and puts it face up, to begin the ‘put down’ pile.

START PLAYING
The person to the left of the dealer begins the game.

When it’s your turn you must put down a card matching the top card on the ‘put down’ pile, either being the same type of word (adjective, noun, verb or conjunction) or having a matching punctuation sign
(! , ? ‘ : “” . ). 
You can also put down any ‘action card’ (see action card).
 
EXAMPLE: If the top card on the “put down’ pile is the word ‘happy’ with a : on it, the next person must put down either another adjective card, a card with a : on it or a action card (see Action Cards).
 
If you don’t have a card that matches the card on top of the ‘put down’ pile you must pick up a card from the top of the ‘pick up’ pile. This is the end of your turn.

ACTION CARDS
The following action cards can be placed on the ‘put down’ pile at any point during your turn, no matter what the top card on the pile is. When an action card is played the word type is automatically changed to the same as the word on the card being played.

Pick Up 2 – When this card is played the next player must pick up two cards and cannot put down any cards. If they have a ‘pick up’ card as well they can then play that card, making the next person pick up four etc.
Miss A Go – When this card is played the next person misses their turn. 
Go Back – When this card is played the direction of play is reversed. 
Spell It – When this card is played the player putting the card down picks up a card from the ’pick up’ pile and asks the player, who's turn it is next, to spell the word. If the word is spelt correctly, the card is placed on the ‘put down’ pile and the speller takes his turn. If the word is spelt incorrectly, the card is given to the speller and they miss their turn. The next player in the sequence then starts their turn.

WINNING
The first person to get rid of all their cards is the winner!

-description from designer

name.value: The Epic Story of Blank & Blank

item.description:
The Epic Story of Blank & Blank is a card game revolving around storytelling. With just one image card and one text card, players tell their epic tale of either world domination in the role of the monster, or salvation in the role of the hero. The basic version is accessible for nearly everyone and can be explained in two minutes.


 Play as a monster or hero
 Create your own universe with the cards dealt
 See what friends can come up with in two minutes
 Unleash the creativity in a room with stories you won't expect


—description from the designer

A hex-and-counter game covering this most decisive Russian Front battle, 30Sep41-31Jan42 in 8 semi-monthly turns at 20 miles - 32 kilometers - per hex and basically corps to army scale. Map scale is same as for SPI's now classic War in Europe. German operational intelligence limited by Russian maskirova/deception pieces.

4 especially strong panzer divisions are broken out for deep penetration and exchange small change.

Simple airpower units and rules, including Russian paradrops ... if both korps aren't already eaten up in the ground battle.

Unpredictable, press-your-luck combat system for risk-takers, along with extra German offensive phases - one at the start and another later ... which also makes for good solitaire play.

And my famous/notorious Siberian Reserve Gamble. :-)

—description from the designer

Building on the success of Ophidian 2360, this release features a completely new time, expanded card pool for multiplayer support, durable storage box, dice, tokens, and more!

Take your team of gladiators and crush your opponents!

—description from the publisher

link.value: Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard

item.description:
In Ubongo, players compete to solve individual puzzles as quickly as they can. Ubongo! Fun-Size Edition keeps this same idea, but challenges players to complete puzzles in a new way.

In the game, each player has a set of eight polyomino pieces, each a different color. Players decide before the game begins whether they'll use the A- or B-side of the puzzle cards, with the A-side puzzles requiring exactly three pieces to complete and the B-side puzzles requiring exactly four. Which pieces? Well, you have to figure that out for yourself, with each puzzle having at least three different solutions.

At the start of a round, each player receives a new puzzle card and must race to fill in the blank spaces as quickly as possible. As soon as one player has done this, they start counting down to zero and everyone else must complete their puzzle before time is up. Whoever completes their puzzle card in time keeps the card for a point; the player who started the countdown both keeps their card and earns a gemstone worth one point. After eight rounds, the player with the most points wins.

To even the playing field between adults and children in Ubongo! Fun-Size Edition, the adults can play without the yellow piece — a straight line that covers three spaces. All of the puzzles can be solved without this piece, but doing so will be more difficult than normal...

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Planetex is a game for 2 to 4 players from 60 to 90 minutes long. The players embody space carriers. Playing their action cards, they will have to travel the solar system collecting resources and delivering them to the planets that require them fulfilling missions and improving their ship.
—description from the publisher

Planetex es un juego para 2 a 4 jugadores de 60 a 90 minutos de duración. Los jugadores encarnan a transportistas espaciales. Jugando sus cartas de acción deberán recorrer el sistema solar recogiendo recursos y entregándolos en los planetas que los requieran cumpliendo misiones y mejorando su nave.
—description from the publisher (Spanish)

A natural disaster (or three!) has ravaged your town. People need food, water, and supplies, and time is running out. You need money now and lots of it. Can you navigate the twists and turns of utter destruction to save the lives of everyone in town before nature strikes again?
Master of Disaster is an educational board game that teaches about natural disasters and what to do if one hits in a fun and interactive way. Each team, or agency, has to protect the US from disasters, purchasing insurance-like protection based on risk and cost estimates. They earn money answering questions on the disasters. Each agency hopes to have to most money left at the end.
For each one sold, 100% of the profits go to hurricane relief.

name.value: Lustiges Braut und Bräutigams oder Verheutathungs Spiel

item.description:
Each player pays an equal amount of coins into the center space (wedding ceremony). The players roll 2 dice. If they roll two equal numbers they win the corresponding amount of coins from the center space. If a player rolls two different numbers, he has to pay the corresponding amount of coins into the center space.

On rolling two sixes, the player gets half the coins from the center space and the game starts anew.

—user summary

"The tactical unit has intervened in a hostage robbery, but the robbers have disappeared, what happened?, why? Follow the clues with your team of investigators to answer these questions and other questions. Will you find the stolen jewels?" (from the back cover of the game)

In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded. During your turn, each player must perform one of the following actions:

A) Reveal information:
Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recomend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant
to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. Each right answer will add two points.

link.value: GDM Games Q System Sherlock Line

item.description:
"The fire in an important laboratory in Oslo hides disturbing events. What happened? Why? Follow the clues of your team of researchers to answer these and other questions. Will you avoid spreading?" (from the back cover of the game)

In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded. During your turn, each player must perform one of the following actions:

A) Reveal information:
Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recomend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant
to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. Each right answer will add two points.

link.value: GDM Games Q System Sherlock Line

item.description:
"Nuria arrives home and finds everything scrambled, and her husband has disappeared. What happened? Why? Follow the clues with your team of researchers to answer these and other questions. Will you solve the mystery of the disappeared?" (from the back cover of the game)

In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded. During your turn, each player must perform one of the following actions:

A) Reveal information:
Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recomend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant
to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. Each right answer will add two points.

link.value: GDM Games Q System Sherlock Line

item.description:
This new edition of Greenland includes the Sea Sami expansion pack so it is playable with up to 4 players.

The four players in Greenland represent the Tunit (Player Green), Norse (Player Red), Sea Sámi (Player Blue), and Thule (Player Yellow) tribes inhabiting Greenland from the 11th to the 15th centuries.

As a tribe, you attempt to secure food, resources, and technology to increase the size of your tribe and support children, elders, and livestock while also wiping out competing species or gathering resources to collect victory points. You must work around the weather and the extinction of natural resources as well as negotiate deals to protect your wives while you decide between monotheism or polytheism. In this tableau-building game, you'll send your population out to hunt native species of Greenland — but some might not come back. (Historically, the climate turned frigid and all but the Thule (Inuit) died out.)

In the game, play takes place over six phases; all players complete each phase in turn order, then the next phase starts. Each turn is one generation. In order:

Resolve events: Examples include elder deaths, animal migrations, feuds, or global cooling. If a trade ship arrives, an auction is held for its wares.
 Assign hunters: Hunters are assigned to hunting grounds, resource gathering, colonizing the New World, raiding other tribes for wives or animals, or promotion to an elder.
 Negotiate: Players can bribe others to peacefully withdraw hunters, including marrying them to their daughters. Players with a War Chief Elder can use hunters to attack others on the same card. The New World turns hostile if there are too many colonists.
 Resolve hunting: Roll a die for each hunter and modify it for technologies and marriages. Success can result in gaining new hunters, resources, hand cards, wives, and/or technologies. Beware, as some animals can be confused by the prey-predator relationship and your hunters might not return. Some successes let your take cards from the central play area into your hand if within hand limit.
 Maintain livestock: Pay to keep the animals you've already domesticated.
 Take elder actions: Examples include invention, domestication, proselytization, and witch-burning. If you have no elders, you can convert to monotheism.

Depending on each player's ending theistic worldview, he has a variable scoring based on successful hunts (polytheism) or resource gathering (monotheism).

Only one may wield the Void Scepter.

Six civilizations clash in an ancient war of ascension known as The Contention. Experience the world's first 4X card game with deck customization, area control, and ship movement. Choose from one of six preconstructed decks, or build your own from a complete collection of over 300 cards (no packs, all cards included).

You begin with a homeworld, in a new galaxy created by location cards. Each turn, you can colonize new worlds, move ships, play cards, and battle your enemies. A unique simultaneous turn system eliminates downtime between turns. Streamlined 4X mechanics keep the game fast paced and tensions high. Cards are played simultaneously in secret and revealed at the same time using a bluff mechanic.

There are many paths to claiming the Void Scepter. Your favor represents your Imperial influence. If it reaches 0 you lose. Weaken your enemy's favor by destroying their worlds, or eliminate them outright by destroying their homeworld. Take the Imperial Capital through force, and use the seat of power to crush your enemy's favor.

Now is the time! Lead your civilization to new heights and claim the Void Scepter!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: The Lion of Khartoum: Gordon's Last Stand

item.description:
The Lion of Khartoum: Gordon's Last Stand , designed by Jacques Rabier, is a solitaire, card-driven board game of strategy and resource management about the siege of Khartoum from February 1884 to January 1885. The Player assumes the role of Major-General Charles “Chinese” Gordon, Governor and self-appointed defender of Khartoum, besieged by the Mahdi's Dervish rebel forces. As the Player, you will have to use your few military units and meager resources skillfully to hold out long enough for British relief forces to come to the rescue…or gloriously die like Gordon himself did.

The game is not intended to be a totally accurate simulation of the siege of Khartoum but is meant to create an interactive narrative and gaming experience in which the Player is required to make crucial decisions to have any chance of protecting the city and its inhabitants from the wrath of the Dervishes. The Player must improve the city’s fortifications, build makeshift Gunboats, mount daring raids and sorties, and tactically respond with military units and leaders to prevent the Mahdi's army from capturing key city defensive locations and, ultimately, the Governor’s Palace. All the while, you must manage to keep up the city’s morale in the face of adverse events and the continuing effects of the siege.

Are you up to the challenge, Gordon Pasha?

—description from the publisher

Bite-Me combines an epic battle of survival between Humans, Vampires, Werewolves, and Zombies with hilarious quirky artwork, cheesy puns, and strategy for the ultimate card game.

Turn other players into Vampires, Zombies, or Werewolves and then kill them. Slay one of each type of Monster and you win! Watch Out, others will be attacking you. Don’t get bitten or you turn into a Monster and start biting others. Plot your strategy to use magical objects, spells, and weapons to battle Monsters, defend yourself, or become human again.

There are six types of cards in the Bite-Me Deck. (Infection, Attack, Protection, Regeneration, Strength, and Movement cards). Many cards are specific to a species (Human, Vampire, Werewolf, Zombie). You can try to turn other players into a monster with an infection card. Use attack cards to try and kill another players. You can protect yourself from an infection or an attack with the right protection card. Turn back to Human or regain a life with right regeneration card. Make yourself stronger or others weaker with Strength cards. Change direction or skip players with Movement cards.

Each player starts the game as a Human. Each player will probably change species several times during a game. When a player attacks another with an attack card, it is a battle to survive. Think of the old card game war. If you are attacked with a level 1 attack card, you can fight back with a higher level attack card. This goes on until a player wins or a protection card is played. If you do not have a higher level attack or protection card, you die and your opponent get credit for killing your type of monster. Strength cards can add +1 to your cards or can lower your opponent’s cards for one turn. The other type of battle in Bite-Me is called an Alpha Battle. This happens each time more than one player becomes the same monster type. IE when a second person is turned into a Vampire. The victor is the Alpha and takes a card from the loser. They both continue with +1 and -1 cards until they turn into another species. Kill each monster type and be human or be the last surviving player and you WIN!

—description from the publisher

China experienced the greatest economic expansion in its history during the Ming dynasty (1368–1644). The silver trade between the Americas and Europe and onward to China had a profound effect on the world economy – it may be considered the beginning of a global economy.

In China, social mobility led to the growing of cities, especially in the lower Yangtze area, which was at that time responsible for the main production of wheat for the whole country. In addition to wheat and rice, other crops like tea, fruits, and sugarcane were grown on a large scale. Immigrating peasants changed their profession to become merchants and artisans. Many people from the countryside were employed in private or state run factories, producing commodities like paper, porcelain, refined sugar, or silk textiles.

Trade and commerce thrived in this liberalized economy and was aided by the construction of canals, roads, and bridges by the Ming government. Ming China saw the rise of several merchant clans, who owned large amounts of wealth.

In Yínzi: The Shining Ming Dynasty — "yínzi" meaning "silver" — the players represent merchant clans developing parts of China in the late Ming period in the early 17th century along the last 200 km of the Yangtze river before it reaches the China Sea.

The players plant crops, sell goods to the rural or urban markets, develop raw materials, build and upgrade factories, and sell their goods to ships already waiting in the port. In order to reach the port, the players need to improve their river transport capabilities along the Yangtze.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Offensive Roads: Stalingrad is a wargame for 2 players covering the 1942-43 winter campaign on the Soviet South Front. The game begins with the outbreak of the Uranus offensive in late November 1942 and ends with Manstein's counter-attack in March 1943.
The game is aligned with the 'Roads' series, which features the titles Liberty Roads and Victory Roads (published by Hexasim). The system will be familiar to players who have enjoyed the first two games, but it has been adapted to take into account all the specifics of the campaign (the supply of the Stalingrad pocket, management of the Stavka,...).

Offensive Roads: Stalingrad has four scenarios.

 Edge of the Abyss: 17 turns. The full campaign.
 Wintergewitter: this small two-turn scenario is ideal for getting started with the system, but is also a challenge for both players.
 Manstein's Backhand Blow: a short but intense scenario to maneuver the elite German armored forces and save a desperate situation.
 Star and Gallop : Starting in February 1943, this scenario shows the end of the campaign from the surrender of the 6th Army. A real game within the game, it allows players to discover these very little simulated offensives and opens up a situation rich in opportunities for the Soviet player.




—description from the publisher

Dragons Arena is a two-player strategy and confrontation game using dice. However, it is accessible from 8 years old thanks to its clever implementation and the simplicity of its rules... But do not be fooled by this apparent simplicity, because the most experienced players are still likely to rack their brains and will take a lot of fun!

An abstract game with dice, for two players ! Strategic, smart, original and accessible from 8 years in the world of dragons...
—description from the publisher

The two opponents play in turn.
In turn, the attacking species must eliminate an enemy dragon with one of its adjacent dragons. It is also necessary that the dragon powers allow it. In most cases, a dragon can eliminate an enemy dragon if the latter has a strictly lower value.
Special case: a dragon with a power of ï¿¼1 is the only one who can eliminate dragons with a power of 6 !
The dragon used then takes the PLACE AND POWER of the dragon it has just eliminated.

If a species cannot eliminate any enemy dragon but has at least one dragon adjacent to an enemy dragon, it must, instead of eliminating a dragon, modify the power of the dragon of its choice (of its species or of its opponent).
Once the dragon’s power has been modified, it places a force field (symbolized by the «square frame») around the dragon concerned, on the square. It is impossible to change the power of a dragon surrounded by a force field. This force field disappears if the dragon changes boxes to eliminate an enemy 
dragon or if it is eliminated itself.

The turn is completed at the end of one of these two actions (Eliminate an enemy dragon or Modify the power of a dragon of your choice).

The duel ends if there is no dragon left adjacent to an enemy dragon after a game turn OR if all remaining dragons are surrounded by a force field and the attacking species cannot eliminate an enemy dragon. The duel then ends immediately.
We then add up the power of the dragons left for each species. The most powerful one wins the duel!

—user summary

Waves of aliens are attacking the planet. After the last spaceship of the invaders arrive you have limited time to destroy all your enemies or they will manage to send a message to their home planet to send more reinforcements. You must build your defense so it will hold until the last spaceship is destroyed.
The difficulty level of the game is set by the invaders wave layout. Changing the layout can change the whole game flow and make it more challenging.

The game is played using hex map and the units are counter that use the classic A-D-M indication.

Game Flow
The turn is constructed from the following phases
Activate aliens: Activate the current turn invading aliens by turning this turn aliens and placing them on board.

Reinforcement: The player receives reinforcements points that can be used to buy units and buy factories that will be placed on the board.

Activate: The player receives energy points that will be used to move the units that are already on board, energies units and launch defend satellites.

Move aliens: Move the aliens based on their attributes toward the cities.

Combat: If there are adjacent aliens forces to the defending forces then combat occurs between them.
Combat is done using D6 and a hit is determined if the result is lower or equal then the power of the unit attacking.

After the tenth turn end of game is checked:
The player wins if he eliminates all the invading aliens
The player loses if there are still invading aliens after the 15th turn.

The game participated in the BGG 2018 war game print and play contest and won the following awards:
2nd Place: Best Solitaire Game
3rd Place: Best Game in this year's theme: SCI-FI & FANTASY
3rd Place: Best Short/Quick/Small Game

—description from the designer

Rules for miniature wargames set in the American Civil War. The rules can be played in most figure scales and the rules are so flexible that players do not have to rebase their armies and armies based to different rules systems can be played against each other. Table sizes can be as little as the usual 4 x 6 to as large as there is space.
Unit be they infantry cavalry or artillery have only one statistics, a Fatigue Score. The Fatigue score of a unit is a numerical representation of the unit’s combat capabilities based on its Grade and its Élan. A units training, combat experience and psychological state are all rolled up into the units Fatigue Score. The higher the Fatigue Score number, the better the troop type will perform....

A cooperative storytelling horror adventure game for 1-4 players where players must uncover secrets about the town of Blackfell. The art, themes, and imagery in the game may be disturbing and are not deemed appropriate for children.

Welcome to Blackfell.
This is not a pleasant place.
Under the perennial moonlight, waves smash against the cliffs far below, whilst on every other side the encroaching forest seems to strangle the town itself.
What is underneath this town? What is outside this town? Where is Blackfell exactly – and how did you get here? Who lives in the Lighthouse and why does its beam change colour? What’s causing that constant industrial grinding? Where is the sun?
And why can’t you leave?
Is it purgatory? Hell? Something worse?
Moonlit meetings, shadowy figures, decaying buildings, abandoned hospitals, pounding rain, and upsetting noises.
Sublime Dark will test your sanity unlike anything you have played before.

In Sublime Dark players take turns to play an action, such as moving to a new area, exploring their current location, uncovering mysteries, hiding from various dangers, solving puzzles, and collecting items and resources to help them defeat the scenario's objectives before time runs out, or before they die in the attempt.

Each scenario links to the next one to gradually reveal a larger story (and sometimes new game elements) about the world of Sublime Dark.

-description from designer

Dig your way Out is a game created by David Simide in which you play the role of an inmates trying to escape from prison.
Be the first prisoner to dig your hole.
Craft tools with salvaged materials, buy them with cigarettes, or extort them from other players, the end justifies the means!

The main goal is to reach the required tunnel points (which can change according to the number of player) representing the progress of your tunnel.

On his turn, a player has 2 actions, which he can choose to spend in:

-Searching: he draws the number of Search cards indicated on the place he's in

-Moving: he rolls the die to determine where he can go

-Joining a gang if he has the matching accessories, and get their passive buff

-Crafting if he has the corresponding cards

-Playing an action card

-Extorting another inmate (extortion is divided into 2 stages:
Intimidation in which the attacking player names the tools he wants to extort (a shovel, a pick or a spoon). The targeted player may then cooperate and give it right away, avoiding combat. Or defend himself, launching combat.

Combat: Taking turns, the two players play before them Weapon cards form their hand, beginning by the defender.
Once a player can’t or won’t play a Weapon card, they loose the combat.
If the defender looses, they have to give to the attacker the Tool they ask for. If the defender doesn’t have this card in hand or if the loser is the attacker, the winner picks one card, randomly chosen, from the loser’s hand.
The loser takes 1 Beating.

Some actions can only be performed in certain locations:

-cell block: dig, place one and only one Tool card (Spoon, Pick or Shovel from your hand on your Prisoner board. You immediately score the number of Tunnel points indicated on the card.

-recreation area: Buy and sell, the local currency is cigarettes.

-infirmary: Heal, remove 1 beating.(a player with 1 beating can't perform the craft action, a player with 2 beating can't perform neither the craft nor the dig action.)

-cafeteria: steal a spoon.

Dig your way out requires to permanently be aware of what other players have in their hand. Thus you can know who to extort and who is a threat for you.

Although picking up tools or weapon is visible to everyone, there are plenty of ways to prevent other inmates from being too pushy: action cards, gang passives and above all your background card.

Background cards are powerful one-shot abilities, which can change the game when used at the right time. And this is even more true when you belong to the relevant gang.

name.value: Beast Masters Duel: Sun and Stone

item.description:
In Beast Masters: Duel, a two-player shuffle building, tactical head to head game, players take on the roles of Beast Trainers. These trainers come from all ages and regions of Tymuria to compete for fame and glory in these seasonal tournaments. Beast Training used to be for protection from the creatures of the Great Divide, as those creatures became less frequent though, it became a sport. Only entered though by those whose bonds with their Beasts was unwavering. The Beasts themselves relished the idea of competing as a team, in a sport, rather than risking their lives.

Set 1 - As the next season begins, trainers are beginning to head to Mesa to compete. This Set contains both Valentina and Shaka, young rival trainers from the Mesa Region with opposite styles! Players may play the preset Valentina/Shaka Teams or draft their own from the 6 available Beasts in this set.

- description from the publisher

link.value: Beast Masters Duel: Tree and Tide

name.value: Beast Masters Duel: Tree and Tide

item.description:
In Beast Masters: Duel, a two-player shuffle building, tactical head to head game, players take on the roles of Beast Trainers. These trainers come from all ages and regions of Tymuria to compete for fame and glory in these seasonal tournaments. Beast Training used to be for protection from the creatures of the Great Divide, as those creatures became less frequent though, it became a sport. Only entered though by those whose bonds with their Beasts was unwavering. The Beasts themselves relished the idea of competing as a team, in a sport, rather than risking their lives.

Set 2 – As the next Season begins, trainers are beginning to head to Mesa to compete. This Set contains both Camille and Tidus, young rival trainers from the Fertellis Region with explosive new techniques! Players may play the preset Camille/Tidus Teams of Draft their own from the 6 available Beasts in this set.

— description from the publisher

link.value: Beast Masters Duel: Sun and Stone

item.description:
Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated extends the deck-building fun of Clank! with legacy-style gameplay! Found your own franchise of the legendary adventuring company Acquisitions Incorporated, and shepherd your fledgling treasure-hunters to immortal corporate glory over the course of multiple games. Your game board, your deck, and your world change as you play to create a unique campaign tailored to your adventuring party. Be cunning, be bold, and most importantly be ready...

—description from the publisher

link.value: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Upper Management Pack

item.description:
In DoppioGioco a Berlino, every place (café, museum, street or building) can be the perfect stage to meet other spies. Players are secret agents of the two main opposing agencies: CIA and KGB. In every turn, someone will have to secretly contact another spy, making a gesture but trying not to be yielded by the others, and give them a precious top secret Dossier.

In this game of stealthy looks, interceptions, paranoia and deductions, you will need to understand who your teammates are and collect with them the 4 Dossiers necessary to win. But watch out for to the mole: there might be a double-agent among your allies!

Where animals once lived together in ancient times, the animals here loved honey.
Honey was a symbol of food and medicines and, above all, of honor in this world.
The world with the most honorable lords!
This lord may be yours.

The weather core can be predicted, but it is perfectly possible to communicate with other participants using information I have identified, such as an unfamiliar weather forecast, to acquire additional information and create my own interests, It's possible.

Game progress

 Create a weather deck.
 Place BeeHive(=worker) on the board.
 Open 1 weather card.
 Produce honey according to the weather.
 Produce goods or make market action.
 Proceed 5 turns for 3 rounds.




Predict the weather and place the Beehive.
You should use your character skills at the right time.
The most prestigious lord wins.

PARKS is a celebration of our National Parks featuring illustrious art from Fifty-Nine Parks.

In PARKS, players will take on the role of two hikers as they trek through different trails across four seasons of the year. While on the trail, these hikers will take actions and collect memories of the places your hikers visit. These memories are represented by various resource tokens like mountains and forests. Collecting these memories in sets will allow players to trade them in to visit a National Park at the end of each hike.

Each trail represents one season of the year, and each season, the trails will change and grow steadily longer. The trails, represented by tiles, get shuffled in between each season and laid out anew for the next round. Resources can be tough to come by especially when someone is at the place you’re trying to reach! Campfires allow you to share a space and time with other hikers. Canteens and Gear can also be used to improve your access to resources through the game. It’ll be tough to manage building up your engine versus spending resources on parks, but we bet you’re up to the challenge. Welcome to PARKS!

—description from the publisher

Yoz is a handcrafted collaborative adventure board game for 1 to 4 players. It's easy to learn, super fun to play and utilizes cooperative team strategy.

Gameplay takes place in the ancient land of Yoz, where a band of characters sets out on an epic journey to navigate the terrain, collect gems, and become powerful enough to capture a treasure of golden riches from the castle of Yoz.

The board is made up of individual tiles, which can be laid out in over 20 trillion combinations, so every game is completely different from the next! Every detail of the full tactile experience has been meticulously considered, right down to the custom wood-burned box it lives in.

—description from the publisher

You‘re looking at the spooky laugh-out-loud, family card game: Quirk! Hallows.

Act out the quirks and find out what works as you collect the spooky characters... Cackle like a witch. Walk like a zombie. Pray like a nun!

But watch out! Other players can steal your sets as you distract... Block... And act your way to victory!

—description from the publisher

NECNON is not exactly a single game, but more accurately a constellation of games, played according to a pair of complementary protocols. If that sounds complicated, the truth is actually quite otherwise.

The twin protocols, NEC and NON, are acronyms for 'Not Even Close' and 'No Odd Neighbours'. The difference between them, as their names quirkily suggest, is that in NEC you may never lay a stone next to an even number of enemy stones, whereas in NON it’s odd numbers that are off limits. Either way, a placement next to no enemy stones at all is fine.

NECNON is a very close cousin to the classic game of Go. Contributing stones alternately to a grid whose cells may be either hexagonal or square, the players (Black and Green) gradually fill up the playing space. The objective is to deprive enemy groups (including enemy singletons) of ‘air’ – i.e., of the vacant adjacent cells which in Go would be called ‘liberties’. At the end, any groups thus ‘smothered’ score points for the smotherer at the rate of one per stone, and the player with more points wins. If scores are level the game is drawn.

A great deal of variety stems from a series of decisions made before play begins: whether to choose hexagons or squares; what size of board to use; and whether to go for NEC, or NON, or NEC versus NON. In all cases, Black (who starts) lays one stone on the initially empty board, and thereafter both players lay two at every turn. Passing is only permitted if unavoidable, and the game ends when both players pass consecutively, or when the board is full. That’s it.

Play NECNON online against a human or a virtual opponent at Stephen Tavener’s wonderful Ai Ai site: http://mrraow.com/.index.php/aiai-home/aiai/ .

name.value: Metal Gear Solid: The Board Game

item.description:
Metal Gear Solid: The Board Game is a fully cooperative, miniatures board game. Following the story of the first Metal Gear Solid video game, players take on the roles of Solid Snake, Meryl Silverburgh, Dr. Hal "Otacon" Emmerich, and Gray Fox the Cyborg Ninja and need to use their unique skill sets to avoid detection as they complete objectives across multiple campaign scenarios. Featuring a highly dynamic A.I. system and sandbox gameplay, missions can be completed in multiple ways and always play out differently.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The world has been hit with mega earthquakes. The worst destruction devastated the San Francisco Bay area. It is a time of rebuilding to restore this area to its former glory.

Aftershock: San Francisco & Venice is an area control game. Players will spend money to acquire cards, which are used to increase population, build bridges, and determine where aftershocks occur. Negotiate with other players to score areas on the placement board.

Spend money wisely to acquire the needed cards that move people back into the demolished areas. Make deals to score points in Aftershock!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Powder and Plunder is a pirate-themed deck-building, tabletop game. Each player controls a ship, trying to be the greatest pirate captain on the high seas.

Players use their deck of cards to control their ship throughout the game.

There are five types of cards including; order, loot, damage, raid and liar defence.

The game includes ship pieces of the players. This is a 2-to-5 player game, with the goal generating both wealth and renown achieved via card play.

Neotraditional Ama is a solitaire game where your dives are controlled by your actual breath. Locate your kanji-based prey within the water. Match the current demand. The dive doesn't end until you reach the surface.

Each turn, inhale deeply, and start exhaling as you flip through the dive deck to locate in-demand prey. Keep exhaling as you descend deeper to fill your bag, and when ready, return cards to the dive deck as you ascend. Reach the surface and you'll be able to sell your catch—if it matches what people want—but start inhaling underwater and only your reputation will live on.

—description from the publisher

Like the normal Abalone game you have to push up to three balls of the opposing player of the board. You play on a smaller board with less balls than the original game.

—user summary

You know, this neighborhood has become pretty dangerous along with the battle intensifying between the Mushroom Fungi and Insects. So the battle begins...

The players are divided into Mushroom Fungi (hereafter called "Mushroom") and Insects players.

Roles and Victory Conditions

 Mushroom Fungi




Victory condition: You win if you find all 6 Insects (Cicada and Swift Moths) and flip them to turn them into Caterpillar Fungi.

 Insects




Victory condition: You win if any one of the Insects survives by not getting caught by the Mushroom.

[How to Play]
---Starting the Round---
1. Insects hide under Ground sheets. (The Mushroom player counts numbers while holding the Ground cloth to conceal from their sight the view of the Insects hiding.)
2. The Mushroom player looks for the Insects.
3. Resolve the action (Flip the discovered Insects to turn them into Caterpillar Fungi, etc.).
---Ending the Round---
Steps 1 to 3 count as 1 round. Play 5 rounds.
After 5 rounds, proceed to the Result Announcement.
Ending the Game (Result Announcement and Ending)

—description from the designer

link.value: ひとりじゃ、生きられない。(I Cannot Live By Myself)

item.description:
NGÄ€ MOANA | OCEANS is the first game in a series that follows the Peoples of the Pacific as they stride from the stone to the stellar age, in a rich Universe of OCEANS, ISLANDS, PEOPLES, WORLDS, STARS, and GODS.

OCEANS starts this epic story on a small Island home. Players play intrepid Characters from the Island who are preparing to venture into the middle of the vast Pacific Ocean, at the calling of their Ariki (Chief), following the tale of a navigator that returned from sea with stories of the Great Fish of Maui.

Players will play as a small whÄnau (family), within the story. They will work to build Waka Hourua (seafaring boats) and their whÄnau Mana, while following the Seasons and the Atua (Gods) that drive them. Players move three Meeples representing three generations of the whÄnau around an Island, collecting resources and building their technology.

The game uses an asynchronous game ending mechanic, meaning Players can finish earlier than others, but risk missing out on building bigger, and better Waka Hourua. Additionally, when playing as a game series, Players order of completion in OCEANS translates directly to the starting order of ISLANDS, providing a connected narrative between the games.

—description from the publisher

In Dawn of Mankind, the people of your clan move along paths, gather resources, have children, create art, discover new methods of doing things...and eventually grow old and die. As your clan goes through these ordeals, you need to pay attention to when your food is going to spoil and where other people might want to go because if they choose the same path you've already trodden, they may inadvertently help you along your way.

You earn points for a variety of things, and whoever has the most points in the end wins.

DINO Sport – is a game-race for all family, where a player wins a victory, if his dinosaur finished first. The participants of competition may need not only success but also smart performance for overcoming of obstacles, such as rivers, ripraps, bushes and barriers.


 wonderful for family leisure;
 easy and short rules, time of development — up to 5 minutes;
 interesting for both boys and girls (as well as for playing different children between themselves);
 ideal for beginners.


Winning a game
A player wins a victory, if his dinosaur finished first, running the established number of circles.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Reign of Dice is played in the form of a team match.
4 or 6 players are the best.

Each team chooses one of the two camps. 
We select and control one of the heroes of each camp. 
There are 10 types more scenarios.
Depending on the scenario, you can play to free for all.

Select scenarios, camps and heroes. 
Each player receives 15 cards from the deck, of which five start-up hands are selected, and the rest are returned to the deck.

Each team takes turns. 
One round is ended when all players play one turn.

Each player's turn consists of four steps.


 Pulling out cards: Draw two cards from deck.
 Face 1: Choose whether to roll the dice. If you roll, must be as moved as the scale shown. If there is an enemy hero in the arrival compartment, take care of him immediately.
 Phase 2: Perform any of the following actions in the order you want them to:
 Use cards (However, multiple cards of the same color (type) cannot be used.)
 Use of hero capabilities (per hero, time and conditions of use vary and should be used accordingly.)
 Store use (the same store card cannot be used as a duplicate)
 
 Card Cleanup: If there are more than five pages of the handle, select and discard only five cards.


Winning conditions according to the scenario or
teams closer to winning conditions will win after the set round is over.

—description from the designer

Vietnam’s crazy traffic is made fun in this chaotic road race challenge where players try to be the first to drive across the country. Meander through busy streets and the countryside, while your opponents try to slow you down with flat tires, red lights and accidents. Start your Drive Pile, build up your kilometers, and look out for Bonus Cards and Safety Cards that can protect you from others. 104 cards with hilarious characters, and illustrated with some of Vietnam’s most famous cities and landmarks. As an extra design bonus, all the cards can be linked side by side to display one huge continuous scene.
English-French-Vietnamese language.
Inspired by Mille Bornes but with some twists.

Strategy game, resource management and pits where your goal is to become a member of the Federation Z, a fanatical, extremist and strangely altruistic civilization dedicated to the conservation and exploration of the galaxy and the planets that form it. In this episode we must colonize the planet Azul 33A, which during the last stellar cycle suffered some kind of global disaster that has diminished the flora and fauna that inhabited it. You will have to restore the balance to the ecosystem, you will have to reforest forests and plains, repopulate the animal species and help the possible natives who have survived the hecatomb. If you think you are ready to restore your balance to the planet Blue 33A you can start your training as commander of the Z Federation.

The game is in full development, there have been several tests with great results and right now the rules are in the update phase, I hope to finish them in the coming weeks and update the profile of the game.

I encourage anyone to contact me with any questions about Exocracy or its development.

I am currently looking for an illustrator and a graphic designer to design the final image of the game, write me if you are interested.

—description from the designer
